title: SolarVillage - Metering protocol w. Carbon Credits on Hydra
summary: Microgrid energy data is stored in spreadsheets and closed systems, making it unverifiable. This prevents trust, blocks carbon credits, and limits financing for clean energy projects.
solution: We create a Hydra-based metering and payments layer that anchors microgrid energy data to Cardano, providing tamper-evident records that enable trust, transparency, and verifiable carbon credits.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
# Comparison to existing work
Catalyst has already funded sustainability pilots (solar NFTs, IoT sensors, carbon markets).

- Many of them start with tokenizing credits first, and then attempt to properly verify them later, almost as an afterthought. **SolarVillage instead starts with the requisite fundamentals: proper capture and verification of information at the source = the individual meters\.**
- Others, such as KWARXS were funded to expand Cardano-based solar investments. But they take a different angle: Simply tokenizing and financing fractional ownership in one otherwise fully centralized project.  **SolarVillage builds infrastructure to help any grid owner with their foundational metering, payments, reporting and carbon credits, bringing it all on chain\.**
- None yet deliver a Hydra-based, high-throughput metering substrate that feeds trustworthy data into any registry or marketplace.

# How SolarVillage is different
We build on Cardano’s Hydra protocol which is tailor-made for this use case: each microgrid can run as an independent “head” that processes 15-minute metering intervals off-chain and commits a frequent Merkle root back to mainnet - a design pattern straight from Hydra’s reference architecture.  The approach drastically lowers transaction costs while maintaining tamper-evidence.

Further differentiators include:

1. **Infrastructure\-first:** we build verifiable energy data streams before minting any carbon or energy tokens.
2. **Industrial scale: **23 microgrids already built or in construction in Nigeria will run as live Hydra heads. With our design, we will be ready from day one to operate hundrdreds or even thousands of microgrids.
3. **Open and portable:** once stabilized, SolarVillage will be open-sourced and offered as a SaaS platform to other operators across Nigeria, Africa, and the world.
4. **Identity integrity:** integrations with Cubid (proof-of-personhood) and ClearPass (KYC + DID) guarantee that each device and operator is authenticated on-chain.
5. **Regulatory alignment:** direct collaboration with the National Council on Climate Change (NCCC), Rural Electrification Agency (REA), the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Nigeria, and the African Minigrid Program (AMP) ensures compatibility with emerging national and pan-African standards. Particularly, we collaborate with and will be one of the very first adopters of the
6. **Partnering with proven builders**: SolarVillage borrows extensively from and partners with M3tering Protocol, which leverages on-chain-first metering hardware. Where they currently save to Arweave, SolarVillage will extend the protocol to Hydra as an option for users of m3tering protocol.



Our own resrch into current Microgrids indicates almost feverish focus on building cheaper and better hardware, and installing fast to get up and running. Microgrid designs are prolific, and HW providers sometimes inclde a bare-bones software package, leaving users with power but microgrid operators with substandard software and investors struggling to recoup their investments. SolarVillage aims to fill this gap by providing an API-driven solution that can control and manage any Microgrid, on Cardao rails.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
# The SolarVillage MVP
The SolarVillage MVP will deliver a production ready solution, with one implementation operational on PreProd (or potentially on Mainnet), verified by user testing and ready for producsion and scaling to multiple sites.

The MVP demonstrates a complete end-to-end version of the SolarVillage metering pipeline running on Hydra and anchoring proofs to Cardano. It shows how real telemetry—collected at 15-minute intervals—flows into a dedicated Hydra head, is validated with digital signatures, and is written as high-frequency transactions inside the head. At the end of each epoch (daily?), the MVP generates a Merkle root of all metering data and submits that proof to the PreProd network, creating a tamper-evident record that can be independently verified.

The MVP also includes a public dashboard where operators, reviewers, and regulators can inspect live telemetry, head status, and PreProd anchor confirmations. Energy-token minting logic is integrated in prototype form, demonstrating the conversion of verified energy data into a standardized on-chain representation. Together, these components prove that Hydra can reliably support continuous IoT data ingestion, auditability, and on-chain settlement logic—establishing the foundation for scaling to multiple microgrids in later phases.

For Cardano, this creates one of the first industrial-grade Hydra deployments producing continuous, verifiable transaction flow, a showcase of real-world, revenue-linked on-chain utility.

We are collaborating with NCCC and will be one of the first implementers of the soon to be launched National Carbon Market Framework: [https://africasustainabilitymatters\.com/nigeria\-approves\-national\-carbon\-market\-framework\-ahead\-of\-cop30/\.](https://africasustainabilitymatters.com/nigeria-approves-national-carbon-market-framework-ahead-of-cop30/.) Once they go live, carbon credits originating from SolarVillage can be found on their site.

A prototype of our dashboard solution can already be accesed at [https://demo\.app\.solarvillage\.xyz/](https://demo.app.solarvillage.xyz/,), and the final solution will be at [https://app\.solarvillage\.xyz/](https://demo.app.solarvillage.xyz/)

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
# Hydra Metrics
- Number of active Hydra heads (1 → 23).
- 15-minute metering TX per head (~96/grid/day), each with hundreds of data points.
- Data integrity rate of signed meter readings (>99%).

# Mainnet Metrics
- Daily L1 Merkle-root anchors per head (~8,000/grid/year).
- 100% verifiable Merkle-proof replay in audit scripts.

# Energy & Carbon Tokens
- kWh/Wh token mints per microgrid (CIP-68).
- Settlement token transfers inside Hydra ($$$ and/or NGN).
- First carbon-credit issuance event (Gold Standard / Verra / NCCC).

# Identity & Authentication
- Devices/operators onboarded with DID/VCs.
- Number of on-chain VC attestations.

# Operational Adoption
- Microgrids onboarded (1 → 10 → 23).
- Total kWh captured as signed telemetry.
- Active operator/regulator dashboard users.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
SolarVillage creates an **immutable metering and settlement layer** for off-grid solar microgrids by giving each microgrid its own Hydra head. All energy production and consumption is logged every 15 minutes by an estimated ~30 meters per head, producing a continuous, tamper-evident record. At the end of each day or period, a Merkle root of all readings is posted to Cardano L1, creating a permanent audit trail. This data becomes the basis for verifiable carbon credits using Gold Standard, Verra, and/or the Nigerian Carbon Standard.



The solution directly addresses the core problem: today, microgrid energy data is scattered in spreadsheets, proprietary devices, or USB sticks, making it impossible for regulators, investors, or carbon-credit registries to trust claims. By anchoring meter data to Cardano through Hydra, **SolarVillage turns every watt\-hour into a transparently verifiable digital fact**. This unlocks reliable carbon-credit issuance, reduces fraud vectors (double counting, tampered logs), and provides operators, donors, and regulators with real-time transparency.



The platform includes the **metering app, payment app, operator dashboards, **and** open APIs** so any microgrid operator can join. After the pilot with 23 Nigerian microgrids, SolarVillage will be open-sourced and offered as a hosted SaaS platform to other operators across Africa. In short: it replaces unverifiable spreadsheets with cryptographically provable energy records, enabling trust, climate finance, and scalable clean-energy deployment.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
SolarVillage demonstrates a flagship real-world utility case for Hydra, showing that Cardano can securely handle high-frequency IoT workloads. With 23 Hydra heads running ~30 meters each, the project produces sustained on-chain activity: continuous Hydra transactions, daily L1 anchors, kWh token mints, identity attestations, and later also carbon-credit issuance. This provides Cardano with one of its first industrial-scale deployments of Hydra in production.



For developers, SolarVillage contributes open-source reference implementations, including Hydra head automation, Merkle-proof anchoring, IoT telemetry signing, identity integrations, and Plutus/Aiken contracts for energy and carbon tokens. These components become reusable building blocks for any team building IoT, RWA, carbon, or impact-finance applications on Cardano.



For ecosystem growth, SolarVillage brings high-value institutions (UNDP Nigeria, NCCC, REA, and the African Minigrid Program) into the Cardano orbit, strengthening adoption across Africa. It also creates a standard, open API for other microgrid operators to integrate, expanding future usage and providing new on-chain data streams that can support DeFi, impact markets, or sustainability dashboards.



In short, SolarVillage enriches the Cardano community with:

• Proven Hydra scalability in a real industrial setting.

• Open-source tooling and patterns for IoT, identity, and RWA integrations.

• Continuous real-world transaction volume tied to energy and climate outcomes.

• New institutional partnerships and long-term ecosystem growth in emerging markets.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
We can deliver this solution with integrity because the project is built with institutional partners who already operate the microgrids:

- UNDP Nigeria
- The African Minigrid Program (AMP)
- The National Council on Climate Change (NCCC)
- Rural Electrification Agency (REA)



These partners provide direct oversight, meter access, policy alignment, and transparent monitoring frameworks. Their involvement ensures the work is accountable to national standards, carbon methodologies, and community-level expectations.



From a technical standpoint, the team already has deep experience across Cardano, Hydra, Plutus/Aiken, IoT pipelines, and identity systems (Cubid + ClearPass).

The architecture (Hydra heads for high-frequency metering, Merkle-root commits to Cardano L1, and signed telemetry from devices) is drawn directly from Hydra’s reference patterns, not speculative design. This gives us a strong foundation with implementation pathways that are known to work.



Feasibility is verified through a phased approach:

- We are already running our own market research with potential Microgrid operators (example: [https://forms\.gle/2kd3ZZ7dtyMBnE436\)](https://forms.gle/2kd3ZZ7dtyMBnE436)) and we have a clickable prototype of the dashboard which we have already started collecting user feedback on.
- We will start with running a single microgrid on a Hydra preview network, and validate the design with experts in the field.
- Then we anchor daily Merkle roots on pre-prod and validate proof replay end-to-end.
- In the second half of the program we validate the design thoroughly with our extepded ecosystem of partners.
- Finally, we expand to 10 and then 23 microgrids, each with ~30 meters.



At every stage, the system produces objective signals: successful Hydra transactions, verifiable L1 anchors, reproducible Merkle proofs, and correct token minting for kWh/Wh units. These on-chain artifacts serve as an immutable audit trail proving that the system works, is tamper-evident, and meets the expectations of carbon registries.



In short, delivery integrity comes from real operational partners, real meters, and real data—and feasibility is verified through incremental deployment, technical proofs, and transparent on-chain results.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The requested budget delivers outsized value because it produces one of the first real industrial deployments of Hydra and Cardano in the wild. For ₳140k, the ecosystem gains a full open-source reference implementation for high-frequency IoT data on Hydra, daily L1 anchoring patterns, CIP-68 energy tokens, carbon-credit issuance workflows, and identity-backed device authentication. These components would cost far more if built in isolation by separate teams.



The investment also brings 23 real microgrids, representing roughly 700 physical meters, directly onto Cardano infrastructure. This creates sustained, real-world on-chain activity (Hydra TX, daily Merkle-root commits, token mints, VCs) and demonstrates Cardano’s capability for climate, energy, and RWA applications. The same codebase can be reused by any other IoT, sustainability, or RWA project, multiplying ecosystem impact far beyond the pilot.



Finally, the budget enables Cardano to secure long-term partnerships with national institutions (UNDP, NCCC, REA, AMP), opening pathways for further adoption across Africa. For a modest cost, the ecosystem gets open tools, real utility, continuous on-chain activity, and institutional credibility. We deliver strong value relative to scope and impact.
